issue.title: Intersections with `@final` types should result in `Never`

repository.name: basedmypy
repository.description: Based Python static type checker with baseline, sane default settings and based typing features

issue.body:
```py
@final
class A: pass
class B: pass

x: A & B
reveal_type(x)  # Never
```

issue.title: isinstance and issubclass should not create intersections if one of the types is final

labels.name: addressed in next version
labels.description: Issue is fixed and will appear in next published version

body: "Intersections with `@final` types should trigger unreachable errors"â€¦ (unless `A` already inherits from `B` of course :smile:)

issue.title: Support narrowing unions that include type[None].
issue.body:
Fixes #16279

See my comment in the referenced issue.

issue.title: Do not intersect types in isinstance checks if at least one is final.
issue.body:
Fixes #15148

I think it also fixes the [initial bug](https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/12163#issue-1131262225) reported in #12163 (this is why I added a TypeVar test case) but not [this bug](https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/12163#issuecomment-1035865305) reported later in the same issue.

body: @KotlinIsland: #16330 should fix this issue.  Would you like to review it?
